text: Service ruined my experience here. Our server messed up my order and didn't check on our table for at least 20 minutes after delivering our food. Will not be coming back here.

The last few times we as a group of mechanics ordered food from Garcia's has been disappointing. If 3 Mexicans are complaining, you know it's true.  The tortillas tasted like they were days old. Very dry and nasty. Very oily carne asada. The worst part was such little food was almost $50. Overpriced and disappointing.

Horrible service. We ordered take out, and when we got home the order was wrong. I went back to exchange my order, and when I brought that home again it was the wrong thing. When I called to let them know the guy was a jerk. No apologies. We will never go back.

Far more Mexican than I expected in intentionally Eurocentric Lincoln Square. Wait time on a Wednesday night was 30 minutes for a party of six despite the restaurant being fairly large. Once seated, only the first modest basket of chips are free, although both the chips and salsa were quite good. The pitcher of margarita is the way to go, with glasses arriving already a little filled and then a big ole jug that has enough for almost 10 servings. Tacos lengua and al pastor were lackluster, but the tortilla soup was excellent - hearty, richly flavored broth with plentiful tortilla strips, avocado, and chunks of chewy cheese. Added chicken yielded a modest amount of shredded chicken. It's a good spot to have comforting Mexican fare with friends.

The service is fantastic here- Jesus, our waiter, was kind and friendly the entire evening.  The drinks were delicious! I had the red sangria and a pineapple margarita on the rocks- oh gosh, so good! The food, however, was not the best. I had an order of flautas and rice and beans. I order this often at restaurants, and I was not impressed with anything on my plate. It was all sort of bland. Hopefully when I come back for the drinks, the next dish I get will be better!

First time reviewing but about 100th time going there.  The food has always been consistently good but today the service was pretty bad.  Extremely under-staffed for a summer afternoon.  Our waitress has been there a long time and I don't blame her for this.  She was running in and out from tables on the patio to tables inside while other servers just walked past us.  There was also only 1 buser for ALL those tables.   This place has been around for years and should add help during the patio season.

BE AWARE of ADDED CHARGES.  This restaurant charges extra for everything... want more chips, pay up, want cheese on your tacos add .40 cent each taco, same for almost everything on the menu.  Want sour cream, pay up...     Mellinnals won't mind they don't look at their bills anyway LOL hence the added charges.   Not the best Mexican food, I had a chicken dish, there was a lot of food and flower tortias more than most, but it was like a soup with a heavy tomato taste.   I will not be returning.    To the owner, maybe you could just charge for the meal, and not try to gaff everyone with hidden charges in small print on your menu.  Some of us read the menu, and some look at the bill befor we pay.   I flet like I was buying a car and the dealer was asking if I wanted tires.  You lost me on this but hey if it is working charge away.  Maybe a charge for salt and pepper would help.
I used to spend many a late night here when it was good but this place has tanked. My boyfriend and I grabbed dinner on a not-too-busy weeknight and both of our entrees had burnt meat in them.

We went on a Saturday night around 11pm and had the best Steak Enchiladas, delicious mojitos. Their patio is beautiful with citronella torches the best ambience late at night just very nice, the service was great and we will definitely be back!

The salsa and guacamole are delicious. Surprisingly large inside. Loud but can still have conversations at the table. Ordered the chicken and steak fajitas. They were okay but too many veges. I would probably get the quesadillas and tortilla soup if I came again. My husband liked the huevos rancheros. My brother got their "chicagosbest burrito " and said it wasn't. Good but not great Mexican food.

Garcia's is a great neighborhood spot. I live a quick 10 minute walk from here and try my best to stop by often. The margaritas are fantastic, and when you order a pitcher, they bring you a full pitcher full and a margarita on the side. That, my friends, is how it should always be. I've tried several items on the menu, and they never disappoint. Reasonable prices, and friendly service. Keep it coming, Garcia's!
I had the taco dinner and my wife had the enchiladas with mole sauce. We loved it . It was our first time there. I will come back to try other menue items

Amazing experience, food was perfect and tasty. Service was perfect and quick. We had nachos with steak, like margarita pitcher, combo fajitas, assortment of tacos, and skirt steak. Salsa with chips was great as well. Highly Recommend

I came here on the weekend with my boyfriend around 4 pm. It took them about 5 minutes to bring us menus, which is not that bad and we decided to sit at the outdoor seating. Our waitress brought us water and chips with salsa. The salsa was delicious. We both devoured that within 5 minutes.  For starter, we ordered 2 Horchatas. Then, I ordered the Lengua En Salsa Ranchera and he ordered the Huevos Con Chorizo. I personally think the Horchatas lacked the cinnamon taste and it was a little bit too sweet. For the Lengua En Salsa Ranchera, it was absolutely amazing. The Lengua was very tender and it came in an okay portion with some beans, some rice and salad. With that being said, I would totally recommend going to this place for some Mexican food. On the downside, it was defintely a bit pricey. The Lengua En Salsa Ranchera was $17.

While the food is absolutely amazing it does not quantify the shitty service.  I brought in 4 new guest to this restaurant. Passing up other establishments that have amazing food as well. It took an hour to get our food . Granted it was busy I get that . Pride weekend... however make sure the food arrives with precision. I asked to speak to the manager. Behold we waited again. The waiter came back to inform us that the manager was busy in the kitchen. I work in guest service and I make sure that people coming in to my establishment have a memorable experience. And not a crappy one. And anyone on my team working is able to take care of the people coming in at any level. The manager never came . Very disappointed in the service. I wouldn't bring 4 people back here ...

Our wait for our order was roughly 20 minutes on a Thursday night at 7:00 and the food was just OK.  It is really loud in the restaurant.  The chips were too thick and were overdone.  The salsa was good.  All the vegetables looked old and wilted (lettuce and tomatoes).  The Chicago's Best burrito was pretty good.  My wife didn't like the fatty meat of the Al Pastor burrito.  My son didn't like the garlic shrimp plate.  Even if money weren't an issue, I'd choose Taco Bell over Garcia's.
Very bad service we will never go back, one scoop of guacamole $8.00 what a joke! Service is horrible it took then 45min for the food to arrive to the table , posole soup, is already made , hello,
Wait time was ridiculous. Wait time was around 1 hour and 45 min. Food was a 2 out of 10. Do not recommend this place.
13 bucks for 3 small tacos, and have the filling is already laying in the bottom of the bag

I have never been to a more inconsistent  place in my entire!!! I used to adore this place. LOVE!!! Now it's the fn WORST!!! The girls at the front have the worst attitude ever. My wife called me and asked if I wanted a burrito as she was near by on her way home. I was reluctant but said sure. BIG MISTAKE!!! They Fd up my burrito AGAIN. First things first the meat is completely burnt. Hard and burnt. That's a fact. I have pictures. It's really bad. So she got steak with everything. Reflected in the price of $11.75. As you can see in the pictures 3 huge bites in and it's nothing but burnt meat. Pictures worth a thousand words but That's not a burrito that's a travesty. This place is starting to really suck. BAD! BAD!! BAD!!! Daddy come home your kids are burning the place down and obviously don't give AF.

I have to say I've been living in this area for several years and have frequented Garcia's on occasion. Unfortunately I just can't recommend this to someone.  While my boyfriend does like their steak burritos, which are big, I always find their food a bit lacking. Their beans and rice aren't very good and neither is there ground beef. The carne asada is probably a better item to get in your meal although the chicken is decent. However I will say one of the reasons we stopped going here is because of the service. We used to order out a lot from here, and on a very recent occasion we decided to give them a try again. We called in at an off-hour and ordered are two burritos. After picking them up and bringing them home I realize that my chicken burrito was actually filled with ground beef, since I didn't want ground beef, and it was in fact extraordinary Bland, I tried to call back several times on the phone to let them know about their mistake.  Four times I called and four times the phone run and without any word was hung up on me. I found this so frustrating that I actually packed up my one bite taken burrito and took it back. While they did make me a new burrito they did not seem very sorry or concerned about their error. Or their lack of customer service. I must say after that experience I was all the more angry about the fact that we had just paid 20 some dollars for these two meal items and I felt like I was doing them a favor by bringing a back and allowing them to make me another one. I don't think the girl I talked to you ever actually said she was sorry for the mistake either. She blamed it on the new computer systems even though she showed me a receipt that properly showed that they had coded my food correctly as chicken.  Poor customer service really gets me so add that on top of only average food and I think we definitely won't be heading here anytime soon again.
Love this place! I keep going back and enjoy it every time. During the summer, you can eat outside and enjoy the life of Lincoln Square.
Favorite Mexican place in Chicago!!!  Love the el pastor in just about anything but the tacos are go to!

Went to this restaurant in March 2017 with two friends that I invited for lunch.  I rec'd a gift certificate for X-mas and was going to use it. Was told that their certificate processing machine was out of order that day.  The restaurant mgr. told me that I would be compensated the next time I came in and so I ended up paying for the lunch out of pocket. Contacted the mgr. (Roxanne) in May regarding this.  Was told that I would be reimbursed $12.00 on the $48.00 lunch bill.  This is not good customer service...
I loved the retried beans, awesome. I love late night hours. The frozen margarita had great consistency but was artificial tasting. Texans do better
They can't handle large crowds, quotes on wait times are totally off, an hour is really an hour 45 minutes. Cinqo de Mayo happens yearly ... and you still can't get it right!

This place doesn't have enough stars. Food is amazing and margaritas are cheap but strong. Definitely our favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. We live across from another Mexican restaurant and will always go the extra 10 minutes over here whenever we're craving some good Mexican food.  And one margarita is enough!

This place is actually good! I've been here 5 times and the food has always been great, the steak burrito is the way to go. Super authentic Mexican food and the prices are not bad at all. Margaritas are super good and loaded, great for their price. I would have given 5 stars but the service is super slow, and I've dined here from 11PM-9PM.

This place was my easy go to for large groups and people coming in from the burbs because it was fast, friendly, easy, delicious, and a whole host of other great adjectives. Plus margaritas and a lot of my favorite hole in the wall Mexican places don't have a bar.  About a year ago I was there and we had a server that had obviously pissed off the kitchen somehow. All of her tables food was late and she was hearing it from all of her customers and she kept yelling "it's not my fault!" I'm not going to hold one bad experience against a place I've loved for years but that experience definitely signaled the end of Garcias good years. Every time I go in the portions get smaller, the food gets blander (like I understand your clientele is Lincoln Square, but cumin and salt arent gonna kill anybody), and why is guac market price!? You know you're gonna sell it anyway! It just seems like a cheap scam with bad food now.

Date of my visit: 12-April-2017 Time of my visit: Very late dinner After the Cubs game, my girlfriend remembered there was a Mexican place not too far away, so we decided to grab some food there. We were greeted and seated relatively quickly.  Busboy brought us water and chips with salsa.  Our waitress came over not that long after, to take our order.  I order al pastor burrito with guacamole and sour cream. It did not take long to get our food.  My burrito looked smaller than I was used to, but it did not disappoint!  First, and by far most, the pork was not chewy, nor did I find any of the fat pieces.  The amount of guacamole and sour cream was generous and well spread out the burrito. Most of the ingredients played well with each other.  My only complaint was I did not like grilled onions inside it. Overall an A- experience.  Definitely will be back!
Delicious! Always busy and for good reason! Totally worth the wait. Love the margaritas and chips and salsa!

Not going to wax poetic about this place. Just going to simply say the food is almost inedible. The most dry, bland sad excuse for Mexican I have ever seen. Chips and salsa complimentary.....unless you want a refill. Really?!?!?! Basic toppings such as cheese, lettuce, tomato on tacos.....extra$$$$. Are you kidding?!?!?! And don't even get me started on the weird dining room setup, along with the 20 foot ceilings that reverberate the sound as if you are in a beer hall. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place. I've had better "Mexican" at Taco Bell.

The food here is really good! Super delicious margaritas, and tons of flavor options. I haven't had anything I didn't like here. Everything has been really fresh. The guacamole is one of my favorites. The atmosphere is relaxed but a bit loud and crowded depending on the day/time.

Visited last night with a couple of friends. We're greeted and seated immediately and given a complimentary bowl of chips and Salsa the Salsa was very good: very flavorful with a slight kick. The service however isn't all that great. There was a slightly long wait until a waiter came along. He wasn't upbeat, just slightly nonchalant. We ordered the Garcia's Favorite. The food came fairly quickly. The food was pretty cool but nothing special. Nice portions. We also order drink special. The drinks were pretty strong and were only five dollars. Again, a long wait for our bill but overall it was decent experience for the first visit but some room for improvement for sure.

A big, lively place. I had the Chicago's Best Burrito, which was actually surprisingly good after all the burritos I ate on the west coast. Not THE best, but good. I also can't fault a restaurant for big portions, but that thing was monstrous and made me want me to throw myself in the shame dungeon after I ate almost the entire thing. Maybe do yourself a favor and split it with someone? You can finish it yourself, but be honest ahead of time, will you hate yourself later? I'd rate my Bloody Mary a 3/5, which means it definitely hit my craving without blowing me away.  Although I thought the Chicago's Best Burrito is incredibly good value (especially if you split it), I was supremely disappointed in the cheese quesadilla appetizer. Small quesadillas, somewhat tasteless, and they didn't even come with salsa. For shame!

Didn't believed it until I tried it, but this is truly the best Mexican restaurant in Chicago. The food is always hot and fresh. Every time I come, I try something different and I have never been dissappointed. My favorites are the chicken flautas and chicken tacos. Rice and beans are ON POINT and their margaritas are to die for! Lime, the classic frozen one is my favorite, but mango is good too. I find my myself here twice a week!

One of my favorite spots. It's great for literally any type of occasion whether it be for birthdays, casual dinner, date night, etc.  Their food from the tacos to the chimichangas to the enchiladas is so good and best of all they have really big portions. Even their complimentary chips and salsa are great. Also any of their blended frozen margaritas are a must try when you go there!

Terrible experience. Placed a to-go order for 4 burritos and 2 tacos. Drove home to find the burritos with stickers on them saying " no beans". This is not what we ordered. I called the store and asked for a manager. The manager (young lady). Was rude and would not accept accountability for the order. She then said to bring back the whole ordered and she will check each burrito to make sure there where no beans in the burritos and then remake my order. After I told her I live 40 mins away and the burritos clearly say no beans.  She told me " unfortunately we can not help you". And hung up. 4 burritos and  2 tacos cost $47 and  after looking at the menu I clearly was over charged. Make sure you check your bill and order before you leave. I will not be returning!
Awesome place for your buritto and taco craving needs!!! I must warn you, come hungry. Their portions are generous! :)

Tonite is my second visit in 18 years  first was in 1999 my first date whit my husband......   So today I was hungry afther a great concert  I notice they close at 3 am so  I decide  have late dinner 15 minutes waiting to be seated  Then 15 minutes to a waiter took my order  That because I ask a Bus boy who can took m y order..      Look like they are fast service whit party's of 4 or more.......  Mi waiter was nice and helpful  The food I have taste for costillas de res or spicy shrimps they don't have on the mexican menu.....   So I order tortilla soup Tampiquena & cantarito Soup was ok The Tampiquena was bland the enchilada no flavor  just a tortilla whit cheese The cantarito was strong but no garnish  I get clearly this menu is for lincoln squeare.............

I went to Garcia's for the first time this week, for a friend's birthday. The place was PACKED, but luckily we had great service all night. We ordered nachos, a burrito, and carne asada. Everything was wonderful and came in nice, big portions. My friends LOVED their margaritas. As good as the food was, it was surprising how inexpensive the bill was. The most expensive part was probably the margaritas. Food-wise, we had enough for leftovers. Overall a solid experience.  Coke lovers: This is a Coke establishment.

The BEST shrimp fajitas I have ever had! Well worth the $22. The entree was big enough to split with my friend and we both took home leftovers! Plus they do not skimp on the shrimp. I bet they gave us a full pound!

I love Garcia's - salsa and chicken soup are the best in the city!  The portions are quite ample, and although the food is not fancy it is always freshly prepared. Friendly, attentive service. This is 5-star comfort food!
Huge portions and great food. The fajitas are a must especially the supreme one full of steak, shrimp, and chicken. Very impressed!

This is by far my favorite Mexican food in the he city. We live about a 25 minute drive away and we still trek up there when we want good Mexican. I usually get the quesadilla and enchilada combo. My husband gets the burrito suizo ranchero. Both are fantastic. Service is always fast and friendly. The complimentary salsa has a nice, fresh flavor. Any time I have guests in town I always take them there for Mexican. I have yet to find anywhere better in the city. You MUST try Garcia's!

Great food, great drinks. Would definitely recommend for lunch or dinner.  Stick with the good stuff, steak, chicken, great salsas. Lots of reviews for it being too spicy. Not sure why you'd come if you don't like spicy food.
The best bartender in the city works here.   They all are good but one is heads above anyone in the city.   Super friendly and fast.   I wish I had his name handy. Ron
My late night carryout spot, some places skimp on the additions, not garcias! A side of sour cream is more than a spoonful. Generous portions and delicious!

I've been to Garcia's on numerous occasions and honestly, I'm not too impressed nor is it anything special. I've tried their tacos and their burritos and I find it on the dry side. I literally have to add the salsa (the one that the waiter/waitress gives you with chips) to the taco or burrito just to moisten it up. Their horchata is ok too. I've been to other Mexican restaurants where they make their tortillas fresh and their meat is nice and juicy yet also tender where it just melts in your mouth. Overall, Garcia's isn't bad but they're also not at the top of my go to list for Mexican food.
Delicious seafood.  Best margaritas in the world!!!! ( I mean it).  Staff is amazing...  I love this place.

This place is my favorite and is right up the street from my grandmother's house in Chicago. My cousin and I eat here every year when I come visit. I never had horchata like the one they have here. The chicken burrito is always the best, I always take the other half to-go for later on. Had gotten a pitcher of a mango frozen drink,  delicious!

After coming here for 15 years the menu changed and today it tastes like recipes have a bit, too. Ground beef normally is very flavorful (like picadillo with potatoes) but today it was bland and watery. Also, guacamole is now "market price". I know avocados are expensive but like lobster?!? Also, only one free basket of chips/salsa per table, that's a change. It's convenient and used to be a favorite. I guess I'll just go for margaritas.
Amazing. Great food,  great staff!  Just great!!! I will definitely make my way back there as often as my wallet allows. The guac was so fresh and authentic. Loved it all!

Came here with my friend for my birthday. I loved the complimentary chips and dip. So addicting. Yes to tacos... :). I ordered fish tacos and steak tacos. The steak was a little dry. Price was affordable. We ordered a strawberry mango margarita. Yes ..they were able to mix the 2 flavors together for us. It was delicious and hit the spot. If i wasnt driving I'd have another. Food was good. Service was awesome and drink was perfect.

I really am not one to complain, I'm from San Antonio Texas and I was born and raised in Mexico City. The food is GREAT! Good portions and I'm sure the margaritas are awesome because I saw one at every table, BUT the customer service is not so attentive. I had a waitress named Adrianna and the bus boys were much more at our table giving us spicy salsa and togo boxes than her. I tried and looked around to see if I could catch her and I saw her by the window of the kitchen to be cleaning the utensils being brushed up from behind against what looked like the owner whose shirt was halfway open  wearing a black rosary. I know customer service because I've been a waitress myself. I don't know if she had a bad day but her attitude was not welcoming.
Ok i love this place but tonight took the cake. She took our order before 3 tables and they was done and we still haven't gotten our food..very disappointed....but my drink was great .

My first time in Chicago and stopped for a bite to eat with boyfriend, staff super friendly and accommodating. Great Tex mex. The refried beans  are flush and flavorful. Salsa with chips amazing and fresh and margaritas off the chain! Will come back before I leave back to miami.

I came here for a casual dinner with my boyfriend on a cold Tuesday in January. The restaurant is nestled in the heart of Lincoln Square, so there are plenty of little shops to browse through and pubs to grab a drink in the neighborhood. Garcia's felt cozy with a huge live Christmas tree and holiday decorations still hung about. The crowd mostly consisted of groups of friends drinking pitchers of margaritas or large families splitting plates of food. There wasn't a wait and we were seated right away and immediately got fresh salsa and chips delivered to our table. It was my first time at Garcia's, but my boyfriend had been a few times for late night food and drinks.  With so many delicious options to choose from, I had to go with "Chicago's Best Burrito". It was a huge burrito filled with steak, al pastor, refried beans, avocado, cheese, lettuce and sour cream. While I'm not sure I can say it was the "best" burrito I have ever had, it was very satisfying. Even though it was enough food for 2 people, we each ordered our own and only had a few bites remaining. We did not get drinks that night because we were heading to a bar after, but we had more than enough food for less than $30.  The staff was friendly, helpful and very fast.I would definitely go back to try more items on the menu as well as get a pitcher of margaritas!

Pretty much some of the best Mexican you'll get on the north side of Chicago.  Highly recommend:  1) Shrimp Ceviche (super flavorful, simple ingredients)  2) any burrito- they are massive--pro tip: ask to add rice inside  3) super fajita combo- meat sizzles when it comes out, fresh sides, definitely enough to share, they don't skimp on the portion size here  4) Margaritas-frozen mango is quite possibly crack-however these allegations remain unconfirmed, but the margaritas remain delicious 5) Horchata-get it to go, walk around lincoln square reminiscing about your amazing meal  Tips for going:  *there will be a wait Friday and Saturday nights, put your phone number in, and be prepared to hang out  *your meal does come out pretty quick, so if you wanna enjoy an appetizer then your meal, don't order all at once--it will all come out at once  *it can get a little loud in there on the weekends, but still somewhat quiet enough to enjoy a date/conversation --just be aware it's a family restaurant and big parties are welcome there  *getting the food to go does not take long and you still get same great portion size!  Enjoy!!!

Came here for a quick lunch. The chicken tortilla soup was fantastic!!!  Very tasty hot and filling. Had 2 tacos as well and they were good. The thonge taco was not the best l have ever had but l have order other things here that are sure delicious.  They had their Xmas tree up and look very pretty. The place is looking up. Also service was very good.  Keep up the good work. We sure will be back! Complementary salsa and chips Easy parking if you are driving Ample space (a bit loud) but the food makes up for it. Reasonable price.

This used to be a late night, go-to spot back in the late 80s/early 90s. Sometime around then they did a remodel and it's never been the same. It's ok, but I can't see ever opting for here over the nearby Taqueria El Asadero. Maybe if you're intent on boozing with your meal. Otherwise, the levels of flavor aren't even close..
Super bland food, awful customer service, uncomfortably loud environment for a restaurant. won't give it a 2nd chance.

Always my go to spot for late night eats. This place is open late and have amazing food sober/drunk. I usually order the chimichunga, but i decided to try out the tacos and tortilla soup.  The tortilla soup was highly recommended on yelp, so i decided to try it. The soup was very delicious and a big serving for the price that you pay. I would def get it again with my meal. The fish taco had 2 fliets of fish which was a lot, but it tasted great. The steak is always cooked perfectly.  The staff is always very friendly and always check up on you even though it's super busy during the weekend. I suggest everyone to go here if you're in the area. Great food and great service.

Garcia's is great! They have great food and great margs. Portions are really large and it's affordable. We went for the first time on cinco de mayo and the wait was super long - but this is to be expected on cinco de mayo. I liked that they let us put our name in and then leave. We were able to go grab a few drinks at another bar nearby while we waited for our table. Very accommodating. They also have a small patio which I liked.

Service 0/10 Chicago' Best Burrito 9/10 Tacos 8/10 Guac 3/10 Food was above average (entrees).  The guacamole was not very good.. it was puréed almost as if made in a food processor.  Ultimately our dinner was ruined by absolute horrible service.  Our server said hello and disappears for 37 minutes (I looked at the text from when we were sat via the hostess to see how long it had been).  We had to order our drinks from the bar and bring them back to the table it was so bad.  With good but not great food and horrible service I won't be coming back here anytime soon.

The margs here are extremely sweet. We had the mango. The pitcher seems huge (for two people at least) because the margaritas are a smoothie consistency so it fills you up pretty quickly. I've read on here that they aren't fresh, which is believable considering how sweet they were, but still enjoyable. Didn't try the food but the space is large, wait staff was nice, and there's a huge selection of food on the menu.

If you want cheap Mexican fare in the Lincoln square/ Ravenswood neighborhood, I can't recommend Garcia's.  I'd go to Primo Chuki's just a mile east on Lawrence.   Cheap food doesn't have to lack in flavor.   We got a chicken enchiladas plate that was drowned in melted cheese.  Before you say 'what do you expect from an enchilada plate," I gotta tell you, the cheese looked like mucus when scraped off the enchiladas.  There was so much cheese that we had to scrape it off.  It was like the lack of flavor of the dish was being compensated for with cheese, which wasn't  fresh.   The guacamole was really creamy, almost too creamy, lacking in salt and taste. The salsa ranchera was liquidy, like water.  Not much taste.  And the mole sauce was thin too.   Our tortilla chips were about 50% crumbled into pieces - like what you find at the bottom of a bag of Tostitos.   The whole experience felt like Mexican dishes made for someone who rarely eats Mexican.  Maybe I just caught the cooks on an off day, so, like all these reviews, take this with a grain of salt.  But if most of the dishes are anything like the ones we had, I can't recommend.  You can find cheaper and more flavorful in the area.

The portions were generous and the service was fantastic! My water never went empty and my server, Elvia, was super sweet and attentive. Also, (and I only noticed as a former server) she was excellent at up-selling with subtlety. I'll be back for another Taco Tuesday for sure!
Went here for the burrito. Got steak burrito. It was great. Fixed properly. Just wish it wasn't so pricey. $10 was pricey, but I'd get it again...

Great food!  Not the most authentic mexican you can find in Chicago but they have some gems on their menu and everything is reasonably priced.  The Margaritas pack a punch and are absolutely delicious! (I normally really dislike margaritas).  Garcias #5 is my favorite thing on the menu, the fajita with chicken, steak, and shrimp is super good too tho!
Sorry but can't say anything positive, you can say the food is authentic but sure doesn't taste like it. Dissapointed.
Bad service. I was sat a tight table all the way in the corner. I waited for 10 minutes and they never came to attend me, so I left. I was very disappointed.

I've lived in Chicago for 13 years and have been to a lot of Mexican restaurants. This one is my favorite. I eat as well as get take-out there frequently. The carne asada is the best, high quality beef with wonderful seasoning and char, and their house-made chips & salsas (both pico de gallo & verde) are the best. Their tostadas are amazing, piled high with toppings. Enchiladas are solid. Mole is great. Chimichanga is great when I'm feeling really indulgent. Chile relleno is good if a bit greasy.  I also enjoy their coconut margaritas. The chicken in their tacos & burritos can be hit or miss, but when it's a hit, wow is it great, and when it's a miss, it's still pretty good, and overall Garcia's is just so awesome that I won't back down from the five-star rating. The only things I've tried that I don't like are the red pozole (the broth wasn't very tasty and it had too much pork and not enough hominy or garnishes) and the vegetarian burrito (too many vegetables with too little seasoning). Their servers are loyal--most have been there for years--and polite. There is rarely a wait except on Cinco de Mayo.

I always have a good meal at Garcia's. I like the steak tacos and chicken flautas, and the chiles rellenos are awesome too. Solid, authentic Mexican food, reasonable prices. We love Vicente and his staff, too. The place is always busy, but they seem to find you a table pretty quickly. My only complaint is that they use a Margarita mix instead of a real lime juice base for their Margaritas. Vicente keeps me filled up, but fresh is better.
The food is pretty good but the service is barely tolerable, especially if you have a large party.

I had a taste for some good nachos so my husband and I decided on Garcia's.  I ordered nachos and added carne asada.  How disappointed was I!!! The nachos I received were a plate of chips with very little beans and tiny pieces of so called carne asada,  that's what you  want to call it!!! With a small amount of sour cream and guacamole on the side.  The taste was so bland, I asked for some lettuce and tomatoe to try to give it more flavor.  I ate less than 1/2 and ended up with a stomach ache!! Never again!!

I've been going to Garcia's since the 90's when the neighborhood didn't get "hip" yet. I used to love them but seem to be hit or miss lately. Don't come on a Sunday off of Lincoln, they just "walk by you". Their margaritas are good but guacamole is super processed. Ceviche tostadas are delicious. Tacos are good and flan is great but pazole was eh. I will try them again but know what to get and not to get next time.

It has been awhile since I have eaten here and the food is still good.  My friend from high school took me here many years ago for the first time.  Years later I moved not to far away and was a regular customer.  It has been more than a year since my last time here. Staff tonight was different from when I was a regular customer. I sat at the bar and the bartender was surprised/disappointed I wanted a soft drink instead of liquor.  Had to ask for a food menu and utensils.  Bartender was more interested in talking with staff than taking care of customers.  Watching waiters taking care of their tables.  Next time I'll be at a table! Two taco dinner and soft drink was about $10 including tax.  One TV had a baseball game and the other was showing soccer highlights.

I live in the neighborhood and I'm always sure to eat at Garcia's when I want to be full, happy, and maybe a little drunk. Their tacos are a favorite of mine and while their margaritas are sweet, they definitely get the job done.

What a disappointment!  For years Garcia's has been our favorite Mexican restaurant---so much so that we trekked the 30 minutes be car to get there.  Tonight--what a change.  It should have rang a bell when we (family of 5) were able to be seated immediately on a Saturday night primo time.  New policy--one complimentary serving of chips and salsa.  (chips are sparse...salsa has changed--now just chunks of tomatoes and cilantro...NO dip)  The chicken tortilla soup used to be the very best I have ever had--tonight, a disappointment.  My husband and I both ordered this--remembering my previous experiences.  What was delivered was a small bowl (1/4 size of the tremendous bowl they used to use).  4 pieces of torn chicken (what we paid $2 additional for), too much tortilla, very little if any beans/corn....and a ton of broth. Perhaps there is new ownership....but we will now find another favorite Mexican stop....perhaps even closer to home.

To start things off, Evelyn was amazing.  My friends, who live in Lincoln Square, and I were going to dinner tonight and decided on Garcia's because I was in the mood for a margarita. After seeing all the recent bad reviews about service there over the last few months, I was apprehensive. But everything was wonderful. Evelyn came to the door soon after we arrived because no one was at the host stand. She quoted us 20 mins. Less than 5 mins later she swung by and said she was having a table set for us. She was also our server. Always attentive, never rushed us, was pleasant, on top of it, and professional. Food and margs were great.  So, to all those bad reviewers, try again and ask for Evelyn.

I have been visiting Garcia's with my family since the early 90s. The food has always been consistent and good. It has always been our go to place in Lincoln Square. Our visit today left us with a bad impression. We ordered our usual guacamole appetizer and noticed it did not taste fresh. It tasted like it had been frozen at some point. We also noticed on the menu that now when they bring you a second basket of tortilla chips they will charge you. That was never the case. The basket of tortilla chips tasted different as well.  Our food tasted bland and was just different. A bad different. Come on Garcia's! We have been so loyal to you! Bring back what made the restaurant great and don't cut corners!

No one was in restaurant, yet we wanted a half hour for our order.  Waitress never came over to see how we we're doing.  The only time she noticed us, was as e were walking out the door.  At that point she said, "aren't you going to take your food"  We just kept walking.  Will never return.

A HUGE Mexican restaurant in the heart of Lincoln Square.  Drinks: 5 stars We went on a Friday night for margaritas and were super impressed. Four of us decided to share a pitcher of the regular blended margarita for $28. They brought us four glasses (already filled to the brim!) and then a giant pitcher. Total, we got 12 full glasses of margarita. Mmm, mmm, mmm! They were tasty, strong and cheap!  Food: 3 stars I ordered tacos, and I enjoyed them, but I've had better. With so many Mexican restaurants around our neighborhood, this wouldn't be my first choice at all. My boyfriend ordered some main dish that came out soooo spicy that even he couldn't handle it. On top of that, it was lined with an oily/greasy residue, so he didn't even put a dent in the dish. Rice was bland as well.  Service: 1 star On Cinco de Mayo they quoted us a 40 minute wait. It was Cinco de Mayo, so we expected a wait, but hold on to your seats as you hear the best part... TWO HOURS AND TEN MINUTES LATER our table was finally ready. What?!?!? There was no apology or anything, and really no acknowledgment at all of their mistaken quote / availability.  Overall, go for drinks, skip the food (unless you don't really care about it being authentic) and always expect a nice, long wait.

Love the tortilla soup.  Good house margaritas.  Tend to sit in the bar area where the bartenders are always friendly.  In-laws always wish to visit when in town.  Good basic Tex-Mex place in Lincoln Square.
Great place to grab a Burrito Suizo; must try the extra hot green salsa if you love spicy foods. Also try their frozen margaritas!

I'm updating my review because the service was terrible this time around. My friends and I had been looking forward to coming here for quite some time. It's one of my favorite Mexican places...I guess it was. I ordered the green chicken enchiladas and they were delicious. They're my absolute favorite. I have no complaints on the taste of the food or the margaritas. But no matter how great the food is, if the service isn't great too then what's the point? The waitress was rude from the beginning. She took our order and we never saw her again the rest of the night. And I'm not over exaggerating. Our check was never even delivered to our table. One of my friends had to get up and ask a buss staff for our check. It was such a terrible experience that one of my friends had to speak to a manager. IF I were ever to return I would request the server I mentioned in my previous review. He was amazing. All in all if you want good food with terrible/no service this is the place to go to!

I love this place for the drinks and because is open until late. I had a strawberry margarita and a tampiquena and my daughter had the breaded chicken torta everything was yummy and the meat was really tender.   Service was good too.

I really like coming here the drinks are always good. And when I come here i never have a problem. But this visit it was a problem. First my friend drink wasnt the way she wanted it she ask for on the rocks and her drink came blended. Then i ordered a drink and I ask for it to be on the rocks but a different flavor and it came back a flavor I didnt order. Like i said when they make the drinks they always good so i kept it. I dont think she was able to hear that night but she should have maybe sure before she walked away..service is everything to keep people coming back also...

I have been coming to Garcias for about 15years. It's been my families go to Mexican food restaurant since I was a kid. Fast forward to today, I don't think I'll be returning. The quality of my steak tacos was way below my expectations. The steak was dry and had no flavor! Add to that poor service and bad attitudes of a noticeably newer and younger staff and this experience was at best 2 stars. I guess the hunt for my next go to Mexican restaurant starts now.

This is barely even run of the mill Mexican food. It's got a good location and seems to always be busy, but there are a helluva lot of better Mexican places in the city. It's kind of loud. Service seems competent. We won't be going here again any time soon.

Garcia's has not disappointed me yet. The portions are large, prices are reasonably low, and they have a lot of vegetarian options. While the margaritas aren't made with fresh lime, they are large and hit the spot in the area. I don't know if I've just lucked out, but I've always found the service to be great!
Worst Mexican i ever had. Service slow..disappointed. Haven't tried their margaritas but the food was nowhere near uncle Julios..

Garcias has some truly great food. There are times when you go to restaurant and you go to bed and then you never think about it again; Garcias is not that place. The food at Garcia's have you dreaming about it months later. One day in the middle of the night you'll  wake up and think, "Mmmmmm I wish I had some mole enchiladas...." Their horchata is perfect and their margaritas are generous with the liquor. They're super busy and their staff is always trying to give you the best service they can provide / sometimes that means a wait. But they do their absolute best. I've never had anything but a wonderful experience here!

The food is good, but the service is beyond awful! The table next to us has gotten waited on hand and foot while we couldn't even get our appetizer until our meal came and had to ask for drinks, napkins, chips and salsa multiple times. The only reason garcias is still here is because of the liquor.
Very good food. If you are in the mood for margaritas this is the place for you. Super authentic Mexican food.

Haven't been here in years. We were in the neighborhood and decided on Mexican, so we figured we'd stop in.  Long and short if it-order was wrong (missing ingredients) and waitress never came back for the entire meal to check on us or see how the food was.  If she would have come back and given me a chance to tell her about the error in the order, and for them to correct it, I may have been  a little more understanding.  She only finally came back after we were finished with the meal. It was a good 20 minutes and they were not that busy. She did find plenty of time to talk to the other waitstaff instead.  I asked her to make sure we were not charged for the extra ingredients we ordered that were not put into the meal.  All we got was "oh they didn't put it in there?"  It was not  on the bill, but nothing further as far as an apology etc.  On another small note,  I find it odd that they bring you room temperature water with no ice in it, but that's not that big a deal.  Pretty disappointing. Now there's a real reason we won't be back in the near future. For as many Mexican restaurants as there are in Chicago, poor service is a deal breaker that will make us pass up Garcia's for sure going forward.

I drive from glenview Illinois for take out, every time I come they always mess up my order . Only reason I go back is I always think maybe they'll get it right. Nope nope nope! Don't order take out, to go in and sit yes, but take out forget it. Zero stars if possible

Very disappointed with last night's experience.  I had salsa verde enchiladas. They were delicious. The guacamole appetizer was very bland. But what was very disappointing was the service. Our server was so cold and rude from the minute we sat down. It was not busy at all for us to have been ignored the way we were the entire night. No water refills--nothing. We were not checked on for over an hour. For us to have to wave down a busboy to bring us our check after trying to leave for more than half an hour says a lot. Then to not only have our check brought to us by a random employee but told to go pay in front when ready was even more insulting. I recommended this place to friends. It was their first time. After this terrible service we experienced, I looked like a fool, and there's no chance of us coming back. It was one of the worst dining experiences ever. Enough for us to just be upset by the end of the night. What good is it to have good food if the service is absolutely terrible? It is very upsetting because we're not a rude group of people. We're very polite to our servers and tip well! I don't know who our server was because I saw her about two times. Our ticket said "Mayra".

I've been to Garcia's maybe a dozen times over the past two years because it's in the neighborhood and close to other places I'm visiting. The food - when you get what you order in a timely fashion - is pretty good. But getting what you order the first time is pure luck at best, and you might as well forget "timely" because it's simply not going to happen. Case in point is this past Friday's visit. Arrived at 5pm so the crowd wasn't all that busy yet. Party of 2 seated quickly with menus. Five minutes goes by and we finally get water, chips and silverware. Another five minutes goes by and no server. After flagging down one of the chip-and-water folks server finally appears. We order iced tea for drinks (having been burned in the past by REALLY LONG waits for alcohol), guacamole as an appetizer, my date orders two tacos, I order a burrito dinner with cheese and green sauce. No modifications, no special anything. Guacamole arrives fairly quickly and was tasty, but we ran out of chips and had to wait for a re-up. 15 minutes go by and finally entrees arrive. My date's was fine, my burrito came out with no sauce on it and no cheese. Sent it back and my date is pretty much done by the time mine came back. No surprise...it's now lukewarm but has melted cheese on it. At this point we're almost an hour into an extremely mediocre dining experience and have better things to do so I ate it cold. We arrived just after 5 and left around 6:15pm - over an hour for a meal that was only marginally better than what you'd get at a walk-up burrito shack...and definitely more expensive and angst-filled. This visit was typical of what I've experienced at Garcia's over the past two years. I've had appetizers come after the meal began. I've had drink orders completely botched. I've had service take so long that we've had to leave before eating to make a movie time. The ONLY reason I've returned is friends or convenience and misplaced hope that they'll finally get it right. But after last night Garcia's is off my list unless friends insist. Even though the food isn't bad it's just not worth the time, expense and anxiety just to get a burrito.

We've been here several times.  The food and drinks are good, but it's always very loud, and there's usually a wait.  I prefer El Nuevo, but this place will work if you're not willing to go out of the neighborhood.

We like Garcias....not innovative cuisine....not truly authentic Mexican....but goddam tasty....Posole is especially good.....enchiladas are delightful....whole beans are the bomb....two identical pictures in men's room of the exact same horse....love it! Margaritas are fairly weak, so get a double (although compared to here in Maine, they are potent....seriously Maine, why are all Margs so lame here?) Anyway, this place is hoppin every day...and for good reason. Cheap, good and fun.

Margarita's are fluorescent yellow- first bad sign! Ordered salsa ranchera enchiladas and it came out with barely any sauce. When I asked for more sauce she said 'we don't really do that', double checked with the kitchen, came back 10 minutes later and said 'yeah they're not really about that'!!!  How do you not have more sauce? In general, service was slow & food was below mediocre. Margaritas were almost undrinkable.

Went last night with two friends. The atmosphere is great and the location is pretty sweet too. They have an outdoor patio which is first come first serve, which we waited about 15min for (not that bad considering the place was PACKED inside and out). I feel like they give a whole lot more attention to the people inside considering we waited about 20min just to order drinks. After receiving food it took about 30min to get a hold of our waitress just so we can get another glass of water. Food wise- the prices are reasonable, my friend got a chicken burrito that he loved for $7, another chicken breast plate for $12 and I got the chicken fajitas (we love our chicken, clearly!) for $16. While I do think my plate was a bit unreasonable compared to the others. One thing I thought was pretty unusual was the price tag of the drinks, considering a chicken breast plate was $12 and the margarita we had was $12.50.  So, all in all its a nice place to attend with friends if the weather is reasonable because I'd recommend the patio way more than the inside (it is summer after all). But be aware that if you do decide to sit outside, you won't get as much attention as you should be.

4 stars: Latest conversation Waiter: What would you like to drink? Me: Cutty Sark 100 Proof on the rocks Waiter: (comes back 5 mins later) we are out of Cutty Sark Me: Do you have Laphroaig? Waiter: Yes Me: Laphroaig on the rocks Waiter: (comes back 7 mins later) we are out. WTF! Why do they use a lime mix in their Margaritas instead of fresh lime juice?  Do they have the best Mexican food? Or most authentic? NOPE! On the merit of their drinks and food they would get 3 stars. So why the 4 stars? I have never really had a bad experience. Usually when I come here I come with a group of peeps. Garcia's always comes through. They find a table fast even when busy. Drinks and food are brought out quickly. Even when they have the occasional billing issue it is rectified quickly and apologetically. The drink issue above they rectified that issue with Buchanan's on the rocks on the house. Ok I take away the WTF. In addition to the service I always have a good time. Usually it's late, drinks are involved fast Mexican food helps.  Garcia's is that nice late night spot that always hits the spot. No they don't have the best Mexican food. Yes they still use mix's in Margaritas. But at 1am with drinks involved Garcia's hits the spot like nobody's business and it's usually pretty fun doing whatever it is we do there.
I fucking love this place can't get enough of it I will eat here every time I get a chance as long as I live in Chicago by far one of the best Mexican joints I ever ate at
Great prices, large portions. Overall a nice place for Mexican food. My only recommendation would be to ask for light cheese as my meal had so much on it I could barely eat it.

Up until today I was a weekly local customer. I happened to walk through the restaurant "cutting through" to pick up a gift for a friend before ordering take out lunch. I was rudely chased down by a server who chastised me in front of the entire patio for quietly walking through the restaurant. They will never get my business again, which included my plans for a 35 person agency dinner. Their decent food isn't worth the terrible service. Wish someone was as fast at getting me my food as that chick who chased me down. Get take out or don't go. Never. Going. Back.
Big portions. Fantastic margaritas. Friendly service. Food always tends to come out of the kitchen quite quickly.

I come to Garcia's on a semi-regular basis, and last night was possibly one of the worst experiences ever. A gal and I wanted to come have some margaritas and maybe an appetizer and met around 9. I got there earlier, and found a tall 2-top in the bar area that I was told I could sit at. Waitresses pass by, no one acknowledging my presence. After 8 minutes one finally came up - and verbatim asked me "are you ready to order" No, I just got here and was waiting for you. I put in my drink order, but said I was waiting for someone else. Drink came out slow ( but the bar was packed so that I'll excuse). Anyways, it was very busy and loud for a Tuesday night - and while I'm glad they are doing so well, service was lacking big time. When my friend arrived, we asked if we could move outside. I know this can sometimes be a process transferring checks to other servers/moving etc...but all we'd collectively ordered was one drink at that time, so the amount of attitude I received about it was thoroughly unnecessary. Rude, rude, waitress.  So after we were outside, it was quick to realize service would be just as bad as inside, just quieter. It became clear there was only one server outside, and I totally sympathize with feeling overwhelmed in a restaurant job. That being said, she was inattentive, and particularly forgetful with us. Everything took WAY too long. My friend asked for a drink menu, and that came almost 10 minutes later. Cue to 10 minutes following that when our orders were taken. I got the ceviche, which I always love there, and that was no disappointment, but when we felt ready to leave and move on from the poor service, even that wasn't quick. I asked for a container for my ceviche, and this time 10 minutes passed before she acknowledged that she forgot the container, cue to another 5-10 minutes before I got said container. Other tables around us got their food orders in and on the table before I got my container...but I digress (this has nothing to do with the wonderful, fast kitchen at Garcias - always a great experience with that staff). This was about the server and service.  I am aware that business can make a food service overwhelming and slow, but it clearly wasn't across the board. The glacial pace was SO disappointing, and went without acknowledgment or apology. If I was serving like that, I would've been apologizing profusely, but she hardly left us with even a thank you. Sandra, an acknowledgment would've gone a LONG way with us, but we left really disappointed. If it was because we ordered drinks and an appetizer, and not entrees...that's too bad, and should be somewhat predicted with patio season. Every customer is important.  I'm a neighborhoodie and have always loved coming to Garcias, but I'll be damned if I have an experience like that again.

We dined at 9:30 pm..Service was slow...Waiter was non excistent..Food was mediocre... I have a litmus test  when it comes to Mexican food..  If I get heartburn afterwards it is not real Mexican...Guess what gang..I got heartburn...Hasty LA Vista baby. No more Garcias...Next time I will take my chances with Taco Bell.

All I can say is I was not disappointed by Garcia's at all.  Came around 9:30 pm after work and I was surprised to find that the place was packed with people on a regular Tuesday night. The good thing is Garcia's has good enough space to accommodate lots of people.  Pros: - seated and had our orders taken immediately - water/chips and salsa were served promptly  - our orders came out after what felt like only 5 minutes but everything was hot and delicious - they have options for vegetarians! A+++ Cons: - the salsa for the chips didn't taste very fresh, also had a weird sour/tangy after taste - not the fault of the restaurant but some of the patrons watching the game at the bar were so loud cheering/screaming it literally kept scaring the rest of us trying to enjoy a meal. LOL The place is pretty big and does carry and echo.  I ordered the enchiladas and was very happy to see they offered veggie options such as spinach and mushrooms for the fillings. 4 enchiladas with rice and beans and two filling options for $11 is a steal.

I have been coming here for years since i live right around the corner. Let me say that the before and after their renovation a few year back has made a world of a difference. I love the atmosphere when eating at Garcia's. Most importantly the margaritas are great and not that expensive. The food is pretty good, depending on what you order you may get an extravagant plate of food or you might get a dish that looks like it was just thrown together in 2 minutes. Usually what ever you get taste pretty good.

Always a wait but they get you in fast! Just give them your number and they'll text you when your table is ready. My absolute go to place! Food and service always the best. Margaritas are STRONG! And delicious! Always recommending to friends and family.

The food was ok nothing too good nothing too bad, we ordered some tacos. The chicken one was the best... The service was slow but the server although she forgot a lot of things was nice... The mango juice with milk was good.

Came here a few times before a pretty spacious area and very loud music usually. But this time it was pretty busy waited for a good 45 min before being seat because it was that packed. Ordered and everything else went smoothly. Good was great and all but felt a bit rushed in the end. Couldn't blame them it seemed to be a busy night.

Garcia's is a very safe place for a get together because it's spacious, has a menu with options for everyone, and is in a great location. The decor is so fun, the drinks are good, and I've always received great service. However, the flavor of the meat is super bland and that makes me so sad! There are so many hole in the wall places in Chicago with much better flavoring, but Garcia's has the superior environment. I do enjoy going there on a beautiful day and sitting out on the patio because you have the great Lincoln Square vibe all around you. Make sure you look for parking on Western because Lincoln is always packed and the restaurant has an entrance on both sides.  I guess you can't have it all!
My wife loves the margaritas here. We always come for the mango frozen margarita pitchers.

I came here with a group of friends back in January, and we didn't have a reservation. We had a group of 6 or 7 people and when we walked in they said it would be at least a 45-50 minute wait. so one of my friends gave them his number so he would get a text notifying him when we got a table. It was barely 20 minutes when my friend got the text saying our table was ready.  I absolutely LOVE Mexican food! And Garcia's has REALLY GOOD Mexican food. Not too expensive, and the food is definitely worth every cent!  Only draw back is that it is pretty noisy, so not the best if you're trying to have a conversation.

Vibrant Mexican restaurant in the heart of Lincoln square. Fills up on weekends and most evenings so you might have to wait around for a couple of minutes but totally worth it. The food is traditional Mexican with little American substitutions.  Pros:  - house margaritas are inexpensive and potent  -portions are huge and menu prices are reasonably priced  -chips and salsa is complimentary - friendly staff  Cons -parking  -limited seating  -fairly noisy and crowded
Not very good at all. I wouldn't recommend this place. The 3 of us had the guacamole, vegetarian combo, #3 combo, and taco salad. None of us really liked our dishes and the guac was just ok.

I like Garcia's for a call ahead taco or two. The horchata is also decent, though now half it's original size. Dining in last night was oooookay. The busboy was easier to grab than our server for salsa and a needed water refill. I liked the carne taco salad, though it made me absolutely ill later that night. My guest #1 complained that his carne  burrito was too salty and overpriced, so he didn't get through half before he requested a box. Guest #2 enjoyed her ground beef taco salad and unsweetened tea...even though she had to pull a stevia package from her bag. Why is sweet n low the only non sugar sweetener at a Lincoln Square restaurant? Garcia's is slipping.

I believe the inconsistent service at Garcia's is a reality.  We've been eating here for more than 15 years and we must have nice customer face.  We've never received bad service.  We can even get a sour waitress smiling.  We've had everything here and it's just one of those places that you've eaten at so much that it becomes the baseline for other Mexican fare.  Not saying it's elevated Mexican, it's brownbag takeout favorite.  We'll always keep Garcia's on the shortlist.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. Living in the area, my and my bf (used to) frequent Garcia's regularly. We decided to go there on a Saturday for a date night (we wanted to eat-in rather than getting our usual take-out). Well, we walk in around 6:30 and stand by the "Please wait to be seated" sign. 10 minutes go by and not ONE employee even acknowledges that we've walked in, or that we're standing there. Literally dozens of different waiters, busboys, and hostesses walked by during that time, and no one even bothered to greet us or tell us someone would be with us a in a moment. Finally, after 10 minutes of just standing there looking like idiots, some random woman who's sweeping asks me if we've been helped. I say no. She goes and gets the hostess. The hostess tells me, it's going to be a 25 minute wait, is that ok? I say ok. She puts my name on her list. 50 MINUTES GO BY. We still have yet to be seated. By bf hunts down the hostess and asks her, "You told us it was going to be 25 minutes, now it's been 50 minutes, when are we going to be seated?" (at this point we're both starving). She replies "Well, I told your girlfriend 35 minutes and anyway you're next on the list." She did not tell me 35 minutes, she told me 25 minutes. AND either way it's now been 50 minutes, double the wait time she quoted. So, we're both pissed now. But we've come this far, so we might as well wait since we're going to be seated next. It only gets worse. 10 more minutes pass and the hostess walks by again, my boyfriend asks again, "It's been over an hour now, when are we going to be seated?" The hostess leaves for a few minutes then comes back and asks "Do you want to eat at the bar? No wait." NO I HAVE NOT BEEN WAITING 60+ MINUTES TO SIT AT THE BAR, BUT THANKS. We politely tell her "No we want a table." My BF then notices there are a few empty tables within sight, and he asks "Why can't we sit at one of those?" And she literally just says "No." So...my boyfriend tells her this is ridiculous, you told us 25mins, at this point it's now been AN HOUR AND 10 MINUTES. And we haven't been seated. She says "Yah, I know, sorry." I tell her to take our name off the list and we leave, starving. I have never in my life had a worst customer service experience. BEWARE, DO NOT EAT HERE. They are rude and don't care about their customers, clearly. There are sooooooo many better Mexican restaurants in the area anyway, forget Garcia's.

This one star review goes straight to the rude and ignorant staff.We were about to stop by for lunch on their patio when the hostess told us they have half of their patio closed because they're short staffed.Initially I thought she was joking.It's a really small patio that a waiter would handle with no problem.We offered to get their food to go and eat it outside on the empty half patio at which she replied that letting us doing will only open the door to other guests who want to eat outsideCorrect me if I'm wrong but your job is to make sure your guests have a good experience at the restaurant because after all they're the ones keeping your business alive.Plus the only reason we wanted to sit outside was so our kids could nap since the inside is always crazy loud.   Other than that average Mexican food at decent prices. I remember better days when the staff was actually trying to accommodate their guests not themselves.

food is good. the staff like the bus staff and other servers and hosts were very friendly and courteous and attentive , the only issue is the actual server, very unfriendly and took 15 minutes to greet us! She wasn't very nice about it either and offered no apology what so ever could tell she wasn't busy at all... she only came to take the order and left never came back once , The rest of the staff was incredible in getting us what we needed since the server would walk past our table and not even Acknowledge us.

I have no complaints at all about this place. Food is incredible along with the margaritas. Sometimes there's a wait but only because people know this place is amazing. Great service as well. But parking can be somewhat of a hassle.

My go to Mexican spot! Amazing tacos and HORCHATA is so good. The salsa is so good that they give for free. My friend ands I are always coming here. Been coming here for about 7 years now. Maybe even longer!

The steak torta was delicious! And very affordable. The food is not over priced.  Great customer service, good music, and tasty margaritas. The bathroom is also very clean! I've been here 4 times already and will most definitely revisit Garcia's.

I'm sorry I don't get it. I never bother to write reviews normally, but this place is so meh. Why is this place so popular? Location? It's not becuase of the food. Not authentic, dry, blah. Been there 3 times Won't go to eat at least again. Drinks aren't bad.
Solid, decent Mexican food in Lincoln Square. Don't come in expecting your life to be changed, but if you need tacos and margaritas, they will get the job done.

Garcia's - and if you slightly rearrange the letters, it becomes Gracias - is a great Méxican place on the north side of the city. Know going into this experience that parking can be challenging to find. However we found a "hidden" pay lot just south of it with the same kiosks that line the city's streets. So, parking for two hours was about $4 and better than circling the block endlessly searching for parking.  Inside Garcia's - definitely not a place if you're seeking a quiet romantic meal lit by candlelight. Very loud! Lots of families and children! But also scads of Méxicans dining there, so it must be good Méxican food, right? Definitely. This was some truly excellent cuisine. The menu is large but manageable. We chose horchata, tacos (beef and chicken with a variety of toppings), a burrito that we split, and they bring out chips and salsa at the beginning. One thing I really liked was that they brought small plates with this, thus eliminating the "community salsa bowl" which I find kind of gross when there are multiple diners at the table. The chips were great and didn't taste "mass produced served from a bag" as is the case in some Méxican places.  The main courses were excellent. In fact the soft corn tortilla tacos were among the best I've had, even off of a street cart in Guadalajara. Service was excellent and fairly quick. The place is bright, airy, very clean, but as I started, very noisy. Fiesta time! Highly recommended. I will absolutely return, and soon!

If you're looking for amazing authentic Mexican food...look no further!! This was my first time coming here and I will definitely be back!!! Laid back, friendly environment, the best guacamole I've ever had and an awesome chorizo quesadilla. I highly recommend this place!!!

Every experience I've had at Garcia's has been excellent. They're Chicago Burrito is a two-meal dish, no shame in reheating that bad boy the next day. Margaritas are 2 Legit 2 Quit so give them a go. Love the frozen guys. I've been here at 2am on a Friday and the place was jammed and it's a nice restaurant, not like TBK. Great for carryout too. Just make sure you specify what size quesadilla you're looking for.

Just ordered food from here. I called to make an advanced order and the woman on the other end seemed very short with me when asking for extra tortillas. I then told her forget them since it seemed to be a bother for her, she then hung up without giving me an amount. I called back and asked for an amount and then hung up on again before telling me how long it would be. So I went into the resturant with no knowledge of when my food would be ready, and they were two women up front on their phones and neither greated my husband and I, i then waited 5 min till she looked our way. Poor customer service! Very lucky my husband loves their burritos or else I would have went to el ranchito!

First of all, I must say I have been to Garcia's many times over the years as I live in the neighborhood for 4 years now.  What prompts me to write this review, is due to the attitude we received from the server this past Friday evening.  After a long work week, we were craving Mexican food and margaritas.  Garcia's chips, salsa, and margaritas are great.  We had a good time, but it was real busy and for the first 20 minutes, no napkins or silverware, never any refills of chips or salsa.  But really service was not that bad, however when the bill came, part of it was paid on credit cards and part in cash.  After our server picked up the tip, she came over and aggressively asked was there anything wrong, the bill was almost $100 and there was only $5 tip (this was not the case as part of tip was on the credit card receipt).  We weren't sure what the problem was as she was growing more upset, she said she should have autogratted us 18% and she would be getting a manager.  Mind you, we were a table of 5 plus a 8 month old baby(he did not require any service).  She then disappeared, probably realized she was wrong.  I got the hostess and explained what happened.  The hostess spoke with the server and said it was a misunderstanding.  Even so, it was a bad way to end an evening.  As I and others in our party have been in the hospitality industry, it is not ok to berate a customer for a tip.  You grin and bare it and move on with your night...  I can't say I will be going back to Garcia's anytime soon.  I can get my Mexican food fix elsewhere.

My friend so happens to live in the area and we decided to hit up a restaurant for a light lunch. She suggested Garcia's and let me tell you, it was aight. It wasn't the best and it wasn't the worst. We did split a dish of fish tacos. We each had one taco. Let me tell you, one fish taco will fill you. These bad boys are HUGE! Seriously they give you like an entire fish. Service was okay. We ate and went on our way. Good place to take public transit to. Terrible for people who are driving there.  I might go back.

Best Mexican food in the city.  My girlfriend and I fell in love with the one in Lincoln Square. They have a burrito called Chicago's best burrito and I can't argue, for ten dollars you can't beat it! You have to get margaritas if you go,  fresh fruit and they stronger then you would expect. The atmosphere is up beat and fun.  If you want the same quality food and drinks at a dive bar atmosphere go the one on Lawrence, we recently moved closer to that location and it's hard to justify going any where else to eat.

Love the food here. Especially the fish tacos! Parking is a drag, but that's Chicago's New World Order.  Wish they could do something about the noise level, tho. Meeting friends on a Friday night for dinner means straining to hear someone sitting right across the table.
I think this is one of the best Mexican food restaurants I've been to in IL by far.  My family really enjoys coming here often.

Stopped by this place for a late night dinner and even though we came in at about 1am, the place was still buzzing with hungry people. First off, the staff was incredibly welcoming and warm. We got seated right away and devoured the delicious chips and salsa. I ordered a vegetarian combination plate and my two friends ordered burritos. So I just want to take a minute here and talk about the burritos here. Never in my life have I seen a burrito the size of a small baby. The burrito was literally bigger than my forearm! That thing was nicely crafted and can be eaten for two meals or split between friends. I like that you have a lot of options when it comes to how you want to dress up your dish!  The food was very good and the portions were large so we ended up taking some of our food to go and eating it again the next day. The prices here are also very reasonable for the amount of food that you get. I would definitely come here again the next time I have hankering for some Mexican cuisine!

The food was ok. What disappointed me was how astonishingly rude the server was. There was no eye contact, he never checked on us, he brought containers to our table to pack up leftovers - but not enough. It was odd. I don't expect chit chat or overdoing it at all! But it was strange how dismissive he was.

If you like burritos and eat steak and pork, don't bother with the menu and just tell your waitress/waiter "Ill have the Best Burrito in Chicago please".   The salsa won't blow you away, hence I docked them a star.  If they didn't attempt to serve salsa, this would be a 5 star review.  The BBIC is that good.  Beyond that, the place is big, clean, and open until 4am.  The good news about the BBIC is that you don't need to be inebriated to enjoy it, but do to finish it.

Came here with a couple of friends for a late night dinner. It was still pretty busy for being past 11:30PM on a weekday. From the minute we walked in, we had excellent service! The waitstaff was super friendly and always made sure that our drinks were filled. They also give you chips and salsa. The salsa was quite good! The menu is huge. It took me a while to decide what I wanted but in the end I ordered the burrito with eggs and chorizo with the added avocado and sour cream for a dollar something extra. It was still under $10 for a huge burrito that lasted me two meals! It had a good amount of meat in it and wasn't just all beans and rice like other places. It also held up really well in the fridge and was just as tasty for lunch the next day. Overall, would recommend if you want Tex-Mex in big portions for a decent price. They're also open relatively late, even on weekdays!

I work in the area and when my co-workers and i are looking for some quick and good Mexican food we almost always go to Garcia's. The staff is always friendly and quick. Prices are good for the portion sizes and if you can convince Mexicans like myself to go to your Mexican restaurant your food must be pretty darn good. I really recommend the burritos, they are huge!

Frequently visited place for me and my crew.  We always receive excellent attention.  The staff remembers us as a group. They even have the ability to remember our names and some of them remember what we normally order. I would love to give you names but it would not be far to give recognition to only the name or names of the people that I have their names in my head because I get equal attention from everyone.   I will say that when you arrive you are always greeted with a smile, a hello, and they try to accommodate your party as shiftly as possible. they give you a realistic wait-time which allows you to decide whether or not you want to wait.  And yes I suggest you take the chance to wait. My favorite is the large premium margarita, you choose your poison!  Ask for what my friends call the fish bowl... don't ask for that because they would not know what you are talking about, it is an inside joke.  But do ask to see what their largest margarita glass looks like and get it if they still offer it. Oh and by the way... I love the food....Jajajajaja.

I really like the food here and would like to give it more than two stars but when you're dining alone in this restaurant please make sure you clearly understand your server otherwise your order of the two enchiladas, ceviche and a michelada will end up costing you over $25.00.   To my surprise my server charged me for rice and beans that I did not order and by mistake I assumed it came with the enchiladas and I was billed for a enchiladas dinner.  I was pretty mad when I got the bill but the service was so horrible to begin with I didn't feel like arguing over the bill and just paid it.  Fool me once...

I typically sit at the bar because there's usually a wait, but I also go at popular times on a Friday or Saturday night. There's enough space for waiting in the front and back and you can also wait at the bar and grab a drink. The margaritas are great, bartenders are very attentive. Food is pretty decent I usually get something with their steak-really enjoy the seasoning, but everything I've had is pretty good. It's not my absolute favorite Mexican restaurant, but I do love going therefor the atmosphere and drinks.

My girlfriend and I got a chicken torta and and steak burrito to go, The food was still hot when we got home and everything was delicious and fresh and the steak was cooked in a way where there are those little bits of char and crispy parts that I love and I never found any fatty gristle chunks that you sometimes find in mexican carne asada. The chicken torta was just super tasty, fresh tomatoes and lettuce, fresh bread, avocado was flawless no brown or anything, totally ripe, everything was so good we split each others food so we could both have everything, their salsas were really good as well, hot but not mindblowing. Also, got a horchata and...it was horchata lol. We will be back. She has told be about this place for a while and has been going for years, it was my first time.

I'm a Texan and was looking for a good Mexican food place that reminded me of home. Garcia's is so good that I moved down the street from them. I always sit at the bar and drink their margaritas; every flavor is muy bueno. My favorite dish is the chilaquiles with scrambled eggs and verde sauce. The staff is super friendly, too. Bonus!

Good solid Mexican food, street food very reasonable with good portions, but the dinners are a little pricey, the margaritas are good, they just put too much ice in them. Very clean eating area. The bathrooms seem new hopefully they will keep them like that all the time.

El pastor tacos, add guacamole and sour cream, best meal of your life. $9 plus the extra toppings, worth every dollar for the amount of meat you get.
